9312G0917-d-12-02-93-SOO.Maintenance Railroad Name: Davenport, Rock Island & North Western Railway Company
9312G0917-d-12-02-93-SOO.Narrative: TRAIN 436, WITH ENGINES 6031 AND 6038, 24 LOADS, 14 EMPTIES AND 2,179 TONS, WHILE TRAVELING EASTWARDAT 35 MPH ON THE MAIN TRACK AT CLINTON,IA, MP 158.04, DAVENPORT SUB, STRUCK A FRONT END LOADER AT DETTERMAN'S PRIVATE CROSSING. AS THE TRAIN APPROACHES THE CROSSING, THE CREW OBSERVED A FRONT END LOADER COMING FROM THE ENGINEER'S SIDE TOWARD THE CROSSING AT A SLOW RATE OF SPEED. THE ENGINEER WAS RINGING THE BELL AND SOUNDING THE NORMAL WHISTLE WARNING FOR THE CROSSING. WHEN IT APPEARED THAT THE DRIVER OF THE FRONT END LOADER WAS NOT STOPPING AND A COLLISION COULD RESULT, THE ENGINEER IMMEDIATELY STARTED SOUNDING SHORT BLASTS ON THE WHISTLE TO GET THE DRIVER'S ATTENTION AND PLACED THE TRAIN INTO EMERGENCY. A COLLISION RESULTED, A STRAIN INJURY WHEN MOVING TO THEFLOOR TO AVOID FLYING DEBRIS.FIRE ERUPTED FROM THE IMPACT OF THE DIESEL FUEL TANK ON THE FRONT END LOADER. THE LOADER WAS DEMOLISHED AND THERE WAS CONSIDERABLE DAMAGE TO LEAD ENGINE 6031. THE CROSSING IS MARKED IS MARKED WITH 3 FT STOP SIGNS, REFLECTORIZED CROSSBUCKS AND BATTERY OPERATED FLASHING RED WARNING SIGNALS. NO DISCIPLINARY ACTION WAS TAKEN.NoneNoneNone

9312H0923-d-12-21-93-SOO.Narrative: TRAIN 430 WAS PROCEEDING THRU THE INTERLOCKING AT WOOD, ON THE DUBUQUE SUB WHEN IT WAS STRUCK 3 CARSBEHIND THE ENGINE BY 104 EMPTY COAL HOPPERS THAT GOT AWAY FROM THE CHICAGO CENTRAL AND PACIFIC RAILROAD. THISCAUSED THE 3RD, 4TH, 5TH, & 6TH CARS OF OUR TRAIN TO DERAIL. 16 EMPTY CC COAL HOPPERS ALSODERAILED BLOCKING BOTH THE CC MAIN AND OUR MAIN TRACK. THE FIRST 3 OF OUR CARS THAT DERAILED WERE TIPPED OVER WITH SEVERE DAMAGE AND THE 4TH CAR RAMAINED UPRIGHT. OUR TRAIN HAD STOPPED FOR A RED SIGNAL AT WOOD AND HAD JUST GOTTEN PROCEED SIGNAL. THE TRAIN WASPROCEEDING AT APPROX 4 MPH THRU THE MANUAL INTERLOCKING WHEN IT WAS STRUCK. CC TRAIN WCS24 WEST WITH 107 CARS HAD STOPPED AT PEOSTA, IA TO SET OUT 3 CARS AND PICK ONE CAR UP. UPON STOPPING THE ENGINEER MADE A 10# AIR REDUCTION, THE BRAKEMANWENT BACK 3 CARS & CLOSED THE ANGLE COCK. AFTER THE CREW MADE THEIR SET OUT AND PICK UP THEY RETURNED TO THE MAINLINE TO FIND THE BALANCE OF THEIR TRAIN MISSING.NoneNoneNoneNoneNone

9312G0919-d-12-28-93-SOO.Narrative: MILWAUKEE YARD ASSIGNMENT 4380 TRAVELING EASTWARD AT 2 MPH ON THE RUNNING TRACK AT MILWAUKEE, RAN INTO TRAIN 424 TRAVELING EAST AT 8 MPH ON THE EASTWARD MAIN, DERAILING A TOTAL OF THREE CARS AND DAMAGING ONE ENGINE. THE SWITCHMAN LINED THE SWITCH FOR THE MOVEMENT THROUGH THE CROSSOVER AND TOLD THE ENGINEER TO SHOVE EASTWARD. THE MOVEMENT, WITH BN 438176, LEADING, SUBSEQUENTLY RAN INTO TRAIN 424, WHICH WAS MOVING ON AN ADJACENT TRACK IN THE SAME DIRECTION. BN 438176 COLLIDED WITH NTTX 66025, CAUSING THE DERAILMENT OF THESE TWO CARS PLUS TTWX 971538. LOCOMOTIVE 1216 WAS DAMAGED DURING THE DERAILMENT ON THE ENGINEER'S SIDE. TWO CONTAINERS ON TTWX 971538 WERE DAMAGED. THE FUEL SIGHT GLASS ON THEDAMAGED LOCOMOTIVE WAS BROKEN, RESULTING IN APPROXIMATELY 10 TO 15 GALS OF DIESEL FUEL LEAKING ON THE GROUNG. THE SWITCHMAN THEN THREW THE SWITCH FOR WHAT HE THOUGHT TO BE UNIT 1216 WITH ONE CAR THENSTRUCK 424'S TRAIN 14 CARS BEHIND THE ENGINES, RESULTING IN THE DERAILMENT OF THE THREE CARS.NoneNoneNoneNoneNone

9312G0921-d-12-16-93-SOO.Narrative: TRAIN 1300 WHILE TRAVELING EASTWARD AT 2 MPH ON TRACK 29A AT BENSENVILLE, IL, DERAILED 11 CARS. THESKATEMAN WAS DIRECTED THE MOVEMENT EASTWARD AFTER HE SAW THERE WAS A 6 TO 8 CAR HOLE ON THE TRACK. AN INVESTIGATION OF THE ACCIDENT SHOWED BYPASSED DRAWBARS BETWEEN VTTX 95414 AND TTWX 990499, 14TH AND 15TH CARS FROM THE ENGINE. BOTH RAILS TIPPED OUTWARD FOR THE SAME DISTANCE. THE CARS DERAILED WERETHE 4TH THROUGH 14TH CARS FROM THE ENGINE. VTTX 93232, 11TH CAR, CONTAINED HAZARDOUS MATERIAL, BUTWAS NOT LEAKING. AFTER AN INVESTIGATION OF THE ACCIDENT, IT WAS DETERMINED THAT THE CREW WAS NOT ATFAULT. THE TRACK WAS BEING SHOVED TO A POST. IT IS COMMON PRACTICE TO POST TRACKS WITHOUT FIRST COUPLING, OTHER THAN ON CURVED TRACK OR OUT TO FOUL CASES. THE POOR TIE AND SPIKE CONDITION ON TRACK 29AWAS A CONTRIBUTING FACTOR.NoneNoneNoneNoneNoneNone
